content.description: Start in a black colored wash/dish.  Move up into the right handed side pull.  Next match with the left to make the side pull an under cling.  Move right hand to a pinch and move the feet up.  Work the left hand onto a nice left handed pocket/crimp and pull the right up onto a sloper.  Move the feet up and push for the top out.  A real nice problem that involves both power and technique.
content.protection: A pad and an adult spotter.
content.location: Located on a small block about 30 feet south of "The Black Pearl" boulders.  The problem is on the south facing part of the block.

content.description: Start on good side pulls and crimps and then work your way up and left, staying on the arete and face of the block.  Once a good stem on the face is found make a powerful right handed toss to a nice sloper out right.  Move the left foot up the arete and push through a difficult mantel.  A good power line for the kids.
content.protection: A pad and an adult spotter.
content.location: Located about 10 feet south/west of "The Black Pearl" boulder.  This line climbs the left side of the east face of this small kid block.
